OVERVIEW:
Landscape--western Cascade Mountains
Landform--earthflows with some on complex landslides
Slope--0 to 20 percent
Parent material--earthflow deposits derived from igneous rock mixed with till and volcanic ash in upper part
Mean annual precipitation--about 2600 mm
Mean annual air temperature--about 6 degrees C
Depth class--very deep
Drainage class--moderately well drained
Soil moisture regime--udic
Soil temperature regime--cryic
Soil moisture subclass--aquic

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Medial over loamy, amorphic over isotic Aquic Haplocryands

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON: Blowout medial loam on a forested complex landslide with a slope of 35 percent and an elevation of 1250 m (The soil was moist throughout when described on September 15, 2014.)
Oi--0 to 8 cm; slightly decomposed plant material, very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) dry, very dark brown (10YR 2/2) moist; abrupt wavy boundary
A1--8 to 12 cm; medial loam, very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) dry, very dark brown (10YR 2/2) moist; weak fine and medium subangular blocky structure; slightly hard, very friable, nonsticky and nonplastic; common very fine, fine, and coarse and many medium roots; common fine and many very fine tubular pores; 2 percent tuff gravel; very strongly acid (pH 5.0); abrupt wavy boundary
A2--12 to 40 cm; medial loam, brown (10YR 4/3) dry, very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) moist; weak coarse subangular blocky structure parting to moderate fine granular; moderately hard, very friable, nonsticky and slightly plastic; few fine and common very fine, medium, and coarse roots; common fine and many very fine tubular pores; 2 percent tuff paragravel, 2 percent tuff gravel, and 1 percent tuff cobbles; 2 percent horizontal lenses of charcoal 1 to 3 cm thick and 5 to 15 cm wide; strongly acid (pH 5.3); clear irregular boundary
A3--40 to 85 cm; medial loam, brown (10YR 4/3) dry, very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) moist; weak coarse subangular blocky structure and moderate very fine granular; moderately hard, very friable, nonsticky and slightly plastic; few fine and common very fine, medium, and coarse roots; few fine and common very fine tubular pores; 2 percent tuff paragravel, 2 percent tuff gravel, and 1 percent tuff cobbles; moderately acid (pH 5.6); abrupt wavy boundary
2Bw1--85 to 125 cm; loam, light olive brown (2.5Y 5/4) dry, dark yellowish brown (10YR 4/4) moist; moderate coarse subangular blocky structure; hard, very friable, nonsticky and slightly plastic; common medium and few very fine and coarse roots; common very fine tubular pores; 2 percent medium irregular iron-manganese masses, brownish yellow (10YR 6/6) dry; 3 percent tuff paragravel, 2 percent tuff gravel, and 1 percent tuff cobbles; strongly acid (pH 5.4); gradual wavy boundary
2Bw2--125 to 170 cm; loam, light olive brown (2.5Y 5/4) dry, olive brown (2.5Y 4/3) moist; weak subangular blocky structure; moderately hard, very friable, nonsticky and slightly plastic; few very fine roots; 2 percent medium irregular iron-manganese masses, brownish yellow (10YR 6/6) dry; 8 percent tuff paragravel, 3 percent tuff gravel, and 1 percent tuff cobbles; moderately acid (pH 5.6)

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION: Linn County, Oregon, approximately 3.5 km west of Pinnacle Peak, in Willamette National Forest; 750 m north and 420 m east of the southwest corner of section 23, T. 11 S., R. 5 E., Willamette Meridian; latitude 44.6026260, longitude -122.1692250, datum WGS 84 (coordinates determined with a GPS)

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:
Mean annual soil temperature--4 to 6 degrees C
Dry days--15 to 30 consecutive days following summer solstice
Depth to base of umbric epipedon--50 to 100 cm below mineral soil surface
Depth to redoximorphic features--60 to 100 cm below mineral soil surface
Reaction--5.0 to 6.0 throughout all mineral horizons
Thickness of andic soil properties--50 to 100 cm (below mineral soil surface)
Estimated properties of layers with andic soil properties
*1/3-bar bulk density--0.6 to 0.9 g/cm3
*Phosphate retention--greater than 85 percent
*Ammonium oxalate extractable Al +  Fe--2 to 4 percent
*15-bar water tension--30 to 70 percent (undried samples), greater than 15 percent (dried samples)
*0.02- to 2.0-mm fraction--greater than 30 percent
*Volcanic glass content in 0.02- to 2.0-mm fraction--5 to 30 percent
Particle-size control section
*Clay content--15 to 35 percent
*Total fragment content--0 to 15 percent
Oi horizon
*Thickness--5 to 10 cm
A horizon
*Value--2 to 3 moist, 2 to 4 dry
*Chroma--1 to 3 moist or dry
*Clay content--15 to 27 percent
*Sand content--25 to 50 percent
*Total fragment content--0 to 15 percent
*Gravel content--0 to 10 percent
*Paragravel content--0 to 10 percent
*Cobble content--0 to 5 percent
*Combined thickness--50 to 100 cm
2Bw horizon
*Hue--10YR, 7.5YR, 2.5Y
*Value--4 to 6 moist, 5 to 8 dry
*Chroma--2 to 4 moist or dry
*Fine-earth texture--loam, clay loam
*Clay content--18 to 35 percent
*Sand content--30 to 50 percent
*Total fragment content--0 to 30 percent
*Gravel content--0 to 10 percent
*Paragravel content--0 to 15 percent
*Cobble content--0 to 5 percent
*Combine thickness--70 to 130 cm

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content:
GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:
Elevation--1100 to 1500 m
Climate--cool, wet summers; cool, wet winters
Mean annual precipitation--2300 to 2900 mm
Mean annual air temperature--5 to 7 degrees C
Frost-free period--60 to 90 days

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content:
GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:
Oneonta--no seasonal high water table; in similar landform positions
Kinzel--more than 35 percent rock fragments; on steeper mountain slopes and short, steep slopes of complex landslides
Longbow--no seasonal high water table; on glacially influenced structural benches

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content:
DRAINAGE AND SATURATED HYDRAULIC CONDUCTIVITY:
Drainage class--moderately well drained
Saturation in normal years--below a depth of 60 to 100 cm in April and May, below 100 cm in June through March
Flooding--none
Ponding--none
Saturated hydraulic conductivity (Ksat)--high throughout

USE AND VEGETATION.content:
USE AND VEGETATION:
Use--timber production, wildlife habitat, recreation
Potential natural vegetation--Pacific silver fir, Douglas-fir, western hemlock, Alaska huckleberry, blue huckleberry, bunchberry dogwood, queencup beadlily, coolwort foamflower

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT: Western Cascade Mountains, Oregon; MLRA 3; small extent

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Portland, Oregon

ORIGIN.content: SERIES PROPOSED: Willamette National Forest, Linn County, Oregon; 2016; name from Blowout Creek in Willamette National Forest

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:
Diagnostic horizons and other features in this pedon
*Particle-size control section--zone from 8 to 108 cm
*Umbric epipedon--zone from 8 to 85 cm
*Cambic horizon--zone from 85 to 170 cm
*Andic soil properties--zone from 8 to 85 cm
*Volcanic glass--zone from 8 to 85 cm
*Redoximorphic concentrations--zone from 85 to 170 cm
*Aquic conditions--zone from 85 to 170 cm
06/2016--Assumed to meet criteria 2 (no ash required) for andic soil properties, in the 12th edition of Keys to Soil Taxonomy. It is also assumed that enough ash is present for the soils to meet criteria 3. Additional lab data is needed to confirm the degree of ash influence.

ADDITIONAL DATA.content: ADDITIONAL DATA: Type location site ID--2014OR043823
